detaileddescription.para: Define an enumeration type for I2C communication speeds
The I2C protocol allows different communication speeds. This enumeration defines the three most common speed options.
Define the I2C communication mode enumeration type.
I2C communication modes include master (i2c_master) and slave (i2c_slave).
Define an enumeration type for I2C communication speeds
The I2C protocol allows different communication speeds. This enumeration defines the three most common speed options.
Define the I2C communication mode enumeration type.
I2C communication modes include master (i2c_master) and slave (i2c_slave).
Define the I2C initialization configuration structure This structure configures the I2C communication mode, speed, addressing method, and slave address
Get the default initialization context for I2C
This function initializes the I2C context structure, setting the default address endianness to little-endian.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the I2C context structure

detaileddescription.para: This function initializes the I2C module based on the provided configuration, setting it up for communication. It configures the I2C mode, speed, addressing method, and initializes the I2C device as either a master or slave.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the struct of "hpm_i2c_context_t" which contains initialization configurations and base address information.
Returns the initialization status, indicating success or error codes

detaileddescription.para: This function sends a probe signal over the I2C bus to check if a slave device at the specified address is present. It is primarily used to verify that a slave device is correctly connected to the I2C bus without performing any data transfer.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the struct of "hpm_i2c_context_t"
address of the slave device to probe
Operation status, indicating success or error codes

memberdef.argsstring: (hpm_i2c_context_t *context, const uint16_t device_address, uint32_t addr, uint8_t addr_size, uint8_t *buf, uint32_t buf_size, uint32_t timeout)
memberdef.name: hpm_i2c_master_addr_write_blocking

briefdescription.para: I2C master write data to a device's address over I2C in blocking mode.

detaileddescription.para: This function writes data to a specific device over the I2C bus in a blocking manner. It requires the base address of the I2C peripheral, the device's I2C address, the address within the device, the address size, the data buffer, and the buffer size. The function ensures that the data transfer is completed within the specified timeout period.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the struct of "hpm_i2c_context_t"
Address of the I2C slave device (7-bit or 10-bit address, depending on the hardware)
The address within the device where data writing should start
The size of the address, indicating the width of the device's internal address (in bytes)
Pointer to the buffer containing the data to be written
The size of the buffer, indicating the length of the data to be written (in bytes)
The timeout period, within which the function must complete the data transfer
Operation status, indicating success or error codes

memberdef.argsstring: (hpm_i2c_context_t *context, const uint16_t device_address, uint32_t addr, uint8_t addr_size, uint8_t *buf, uint32_t buf_size, uint32_t timeout)
memberdef.name: hpm_i2c_master_addr_read_blocking

briefdescription.para: I2C master read data from a specified address of an I2C slave device in blocking mode.

detaileddescription.para: This function reads data from a specified address of an I2C slave device using the I2C bus in a blocking manner. It first sends the slave device address, then the memory address to read from, and finally reads the data.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the struct of "hpm_i2c_context_t"
Address of the I2C slave device (7-bit or 10-bit address, depending on the hardware).
Internal address within the slave device to read from (can be a register or memory address).
Size of the address in bytes, indicating the number of bits in the address.
Pointer to the buffer where the read data will be stored.
Number of bytes to read.
Timeout value in milliseconds. If the read operation does not complete within this time, the function returns a timeout error.
Operation status, indicating success or error codes

memberdef.argsstring: (hpm_i2c_context_t *context, uint16_t device_address, uint8_t *buf, uint32_t size, uint32_t timeout)
memberdef.name: hpm_i2c_master_write_blocking

briefdescription.para: I2C master write data to an I2C slave device in blocking mode.

detaileddescription.para: This function performs a blocking write operation for an I2C master device, writing a specified number of bytes to the I2C slave device. Blocking mode means the function will return only after the data transfer is complete, and it will occupy CPU resources during the data transfer.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the struct of "hpm_i2c_context_t"
Address of the I2C slave device (7-bit or 10-bit address, depending on the hardware)
Pointer to the buffer containing the data to be written, data type is uint8_t
Number of bytes to write, data type is uint32_t
Timeout for the operation, in milliseconds. If the operation does not complete within this time, the function will return an error
Operation status, indicating success or error codes

memberdef.argsstring: (hpm_i2c_context_t *context, const uint16_t device_address, uint8_t *buf, const uint32_t size, uint32_t timeout)
memberdef.name: hpm_i2c_master_read_blocking

briefdescription.para: I2C master read data from an I2C device in blocking mode.

detaileddescription.para: This function reads a specified number of bytes from the I2C device with the given address and stores them in the provided buffer. The read operation is blocking, meaning it will wait until the read is complete or an error occurs.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the struct of "hpm_i2c_context_t"
Address of the I2C slave device (7-bit or 10-bit address, depending on the hardware)
Pointer to the buffer where the read data will be stored
Number of bytes to read
Timeout for the operation in milliseconds
Operation status, indicating success or error codes

briefdescription.para: I2C slave write operation in blocking mode.

detaileddescription.para: This function handles the write operation for an I2C slave in a blocking manner. It waits until all data is successfully written or an error occurs, or the specified timeout is exceeded.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the struct of "hpm_i2c_context_t"
Pointer to the buffer where received data will be stored
Number of bytes to receive
Timeout value for the operation; if the operation does not complete within this time, the function returns a timeout error
Operation status, indicating success or error codes

briefdescription.para: I2C slave read operation in blocking mode.

detaileddescription.para: This function reads data from the I2C slave device using the specified I2C interface in a blocking mode.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the struct of "hpm_i2c_context_t"
Pointer to the buffer where the read data will be stored.
Number of bytes to read from the I2C slave device.
Timeout value in milliseconds for the read operation. If the read operation does not complete within this time, it will be terminated.
Operation status, indicating success or error codes
